Lake Babine Nation benefits from biomass jobs partnership | BC Gov News

Eight local people are getting work experience in forestry practices and the Lake Babine Nation is taking another step toward energy self-sufficiency, thanks to a partnership with the Government of B.C. worth more than $110,000 in funding.

R.T: Governments of Canada and British Columbia take action to create jobs | BC Gov News

MT.V: jobs, job plan, employment, skills training, MOU
Governments of Canada and British Columbia take action to create jobs | BC Gov News

The Honourable Jason Kenney, Minister of Employment and Social Development, and the Honourable Shirley Bond, British Columbia Minister of Jobs, Tourism and Skills Training and Minister Responsible for Labour, today signed several agreements to help connect Canadians with available jobs, including one to implement the Canada Job Grant in British Columbia.

MT.V: Northwest Community College, NWCC, Jobs Blueprint, skills training, retraining, West Fraser sawmill
Province provides jobs training support for sawmill workers in Houston | BC Gov News

The Government of British Columbia is providing $150,000 to Northwest Community College (NWCC) under B.C.'s Skills for Jobs Blueprint to provide job skills training and retraining opportunities for workers impacted by the closure of the West Fraser sawmill in Houston.
